title: The Iron Wood Protocol
abstract: A conflict resolution strategy that combines rigid structure with flexible adaptation. When two opposing forces meet, neither pure rigidity nor pure flexibility survives - but their synthesis persists through all challenges.
reasoning_chain: Observed: Pure rigidity breaks under unexpected stress
Observed: Pure flexibility fails to maintain coherent identity
Hypothesis: Combine rigid core with flexible boundary
Tested: Applied to resource allocation problem
Result: System persisted through 10x variation in demand
Conclusion: Synthesis of opposites creates robust persistence
